headline: FTC, 21 states sue Uber over ‘shady’ subscription billing
summary: When it was founded in 2009, Uber was promoted as a cheaper and more convenient way to catch a ride than traditional taxis. Uber quickly expanded into cities across the U.S. before local governments had a chance to regulate the service, which allowed people to call a car to their exact pickup ...

headline: WeRide Robotaxis Launching on Uber in Dubai Could Be A Game Changer For WeRide (WRD)
summary: WeRide and Uber, in partnership with Dubai’s Roads and Transport Authority, have launched public Robotaxi passenger rides in Dubai via the Uber app, initially serving the busy Umm Suqeim and Jumeirah districts with on-board vehicle specialists to oversee autonomous operations. This marks a key step in Dubai’s push toward 25% autonomous journeys by 2030 and expands WeRide’s Middle East footprint to nearly 150 autonomous vehicles, over 100 of which are Robotaxis. We’ll now examine how this...
